solution_line_template: To determine this, we must first figure out the required change in temperature. To do this, we perform {final_temperature}-{initial_temperature}= <<{final_temperature}-{initial_temperature}={required_temperature_change}>>{required_temperature_change} degrees of required temperature change.

Next, we divide this amount by the rate of change per minute, performing {required_temperature_change}/{heating_rate_per_minute}= <<{required_temperature_change}/{heating_rate_per_minute}={cooking_time_minutes}>>{cooking_time_minutes} minutes of cooking time.
